result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Cha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
No contact with any employees, representatives, contractors of Johnsonville or any property of Johnsonville. 
No contact directly or indirectly with AB or HB.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
No criminal conduct.
Not to access the Internet accept for employment and housing purposes and with approval of probation agent. 
Submit any computers or other electronic devices to which there is access to search on demand of the probation agent. 
Must allow agent to install computer monitoring software to any computer or other electronic device to which he owns and has access to the Internet.
Agent allowed to search not only for electronic communication but for telephone numbers, voicemails, contacts, etc.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:06 PM Defendant Brian Cha appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerard M Werner appeared by video for Brian Cha.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that cases were joined for Trial.
Atty Mayer represents on Deft's other case and notes that an offer was extended including both cases and Deft rejected it.
Atty Werner notes that Deft substituted on Branch 4 and that's how this case came to Branch 5. Court notes it was sent Branch 1 and then cases were joined under Joinder.
Atty Werner requests more time to be able to speak w/Deft regarding this case.
State agrees that Deft can enter plea on other case and still go to Trial on this case.
Attorneys request a breakout room to be able to discuss with their client.
(Court goes off record)
1:29 PM - Court recalls.
Attorneys have spoken to Deft in breakout room and Deft is now willing to take plea and resolve cases globally.
Will plead to Count 1 on this case and Count 1 on case 22CF79. Attorneys are requesting a plea/sentencing date. Atty Werner to prepare plea questionnaire/waiver on his case and can file by the end of the week.
Attorneys do not anticipate requesting a PSI.
Court will not order PSI but would like the State to provide green sheet and will upload to file.
